clinic.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a place, often in a hospital, where medical treatment is given to people who do not need to stay in the hospital
clinic.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: an appointment at an outpatient clinic  (=clinic for someone who does not need to stay in a hospital)
clinic.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a period of time during which doctors give treatment or advice to people with particular health problems
clinic.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The baby clinic is held on Monday afternoons.
clinic.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a meeting during which a professional person gives advice or help to people
clinic.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: a free clinic on caring for roses
clinic.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a place where medical treatment is given at a low cost
clinic.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: the doctors who volunteer at the inner-city clinic
clinic.translation[0].definitions[4].def: a group of doctors who work together and share the same offices
clinic.translation[0].definitions[5].def: an occasion when medical students are taught how to decide what illness a patient has and how to treat it
clinic.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: Test results from a health clinic are available in about three weeks.
You can be tested for infection at a special hospital clinic.
There are family planning clinics all over the country.
The staff at the antenatal clinic will give you the results of your blood test.
We scheduled an appointment at the fertility clinic.
There's an outpatient clinic for people with diabetes.
Fees at private clinics are usually very high.
She's involved in health care education at a local clinic.
Pregnant women should attend an antenatal clinic at least once a month.
The hospital holds vaccination clinics once a fortnight.
Clinic staff are hopeful that Stephen will make a full recovery.
